abstract: Nikon’s GP-1 GPS unit, which lets you “geotag” your photos, acquires a satellite signal in about 45 seconds (after being turned on) or 5 seconds (if already powered).
snippet: Nikon’s GP-1 GPS unit, which lets you “geotag” your photos, acquires a satellite signal in about 45 seconds (after being turned on) or 5 seconds (if already powered).
lead_paragraph: Taking a photo of yourself in front of the Eiffel Tower is no longer proof enough of your travels. Nikon’s GP-1 GPS unit lets you “geotag” your photos by attaching to the hot shoe of your Nikon camera (models D3, D300, D700, D2Xs, D200 and D90 D-SLR) or to the strap, with an adaptor.

headline.main: Not Enough to Know Where You Are? A GPS for Your Camera Can Show Where You Were
headline.print_headline: Not Enough to Know Where You Are? A GPS for Your Camera Can Show Where You Were

abstract: The Logitech G13 Gameboard has an LCD screen that connects to most games and can display game statistics, system information or even messages from your in-game friends.
snippet: The Logitech G13 Gameboard has an LCD screen that connects to most games and can display game statistics, system information or even messages from your in-game friends.
lead_paragraph: In the lexicon of gaming, few letters are as important as A, W, S and D. These four characters, spaced in an approximate cross on a standard qwerty keyboard, are the standard keys used for movement in first-person shooter games like Counter-Strike and Half-Life. That is why the Logitech G13 Gameboard puts a simulacrum of those keys front and center with special divots in the keys for quick identification.

headline.main: A Keyboard for Gamers, Stripped Down to the Keys You Need (Joystick Included)
headline.print_headline: A Keyboard for Gamers, Stripped Down to the Keys You Need (Joystick Included)
